details:
Several issues have been found in transfig, a XFig figure files converter.


* [CVE-2018-16140](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16140)
Buffer underwrite vulnerability in get\_line()
 allows an attacker to write prior to the beginning of the
 buffer via a crafted .fig file.
* [CVE-2019-14275](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-14275)
Stack-based buffer overflow in the calc\_arrow
 function in bound.c.
* [CVE-2019-19555](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19555)
Stack-based buffer overflow because of an
 incorrect sscanf.


For Debian 8 Jessie, these problems have been fixed in version
1:3.2.5.e-4+deb8u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your transfig packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
